website_summaries.verdict: Cressi Pluma Fins are an brilliant option for experienced divers due to their responsiveness, power, comfortable design, and overall high-quality construction.
pros: Fits based on your shoe size
Designed for snorkeling, scuba diving, and freediving
cons: These extra-long fins are awesome for diving, but they are fairly large

customer_reviews.title: Sizing WAY off.
customer_reviews.text: Cressi needs to be more proactive about addressing size discrepancy and size instruction. I read many, many reviews across the Cressi fin spectrum. I've now tried 4 different fin sizes, 2 of which are the Pluma. I wear a women's 5 and a men's 3, so I ordered a 2.5-3.5 in this fin. My feet are 8.5" long and 3.5" wide at bunion (pretty standard size 5). These are at least a size too big and my foot walks right out of them. The fins themselves seem like good ones, but I can't give Cressi 5 stars when their sizing is erratic and difficult to decipher.
customer_reviews.author: R. Finlayson

customer_reviews.title: Here’s what you need to know...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome fins. They are long enough to propel you through the water like a fish. I did take the advice of a reviewers. They run BIG. I wear a woman’s 8 shoe. I bought these 6.5 - 7.5. They fit perfect. I am a perfect 8 in women’s shoes, so buy down 1 size.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hanford

customer_reviews.title: Great set of fins!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9.5 - 10 US men's shoe... I measured my feet and got my euro size which was 42. I ordered the 41-42 size fins and they fit good... just a tiny amount of room so if I would of went down another size they would have been too tight. I'm going to try the cressi Lycra socks and see if they fill that little space and maybe give me some protection from blisters from long snorkeling adventures. The fins performed great in the water and are easy to kick with. I can move pretty fast with these and they have good control. Definitely a quality item and made in Italy.
customer_reviews.author: RyeBread

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box first impressions: For fit, I'm pleased. I wear a women's 10.5/11 and ordered the 8.5/9.5-43-44, the fit is good with bare feet, but significantly improved with a 3.00mm nylon bootie. They appear to be well made, and are actually made in Italy. The fins are black and have flecks of silver - they are good looking. I'm about to head to the Carribbean for 10 days so I will be using them extensively. Once I return I will update this review with how they performed. My only complaint, and it's petty considering the price point/quality is that you do need to purchase a bag to carry them in.
customer_reviews.author: Rye Bread

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to the Bahamas. The sizing is off, as other reviewers have noted. I wear a women’s size 8, so ordered a size 39\40 and they are so large, they fit my husband, who wears a men’s size 10. The second time I used them for snorkeling, they broke. Now I have no fins and am in an isolated area of the Bahamas where I cannot buy new ones. I have other Cressi gear and it is fine; but these fins are a major dud. Do not buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Booksnoop

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for regular and free dive snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: Took to bora bora with matching cressi snorkel and cressi mask. Same set for my wife. These fins work great for free diving, fighting a current, our regular use. Fit exactly the same as my us shoe size (size 12). Snorkeled a lot and did not need neoprene socks. These are comfortable fins that will allow you to dive deep and travel far. Fits in a suitcase just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Cressi PLUMA Adult Snorkeling Full Foot Pocket Fins
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fins that worked wonderfully. Went on a long cruise and went snorkeling everywhere we could, some paid trips and some on our own. These fins are surprisingly light weight, fit in my suitcase easily, fit perfect (I did size up) and never slipped off my feet or rubbed, and were long enough to give me full power in a very wavy ocean. If you are considering these, don't over-research it. Buy these and you won't regret it. These are quality at a great price and I'm looking forward to many more snorkeling vacations with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: AVOID - Choose a more durable fin
customer_reviews.text: One of my fins broke during a dive, and after fewer than 10 uses. While lightweight for travel, the plastic rib structure is not reliable and may fail leaving you disabled in the water. (See photos) Being made in Italy does not make up for a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Fin cracked after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for open water swims in the ocean and they cracked at the junction of the toe box and the fin. The ribber rib the runs along the edge held the fin on but it is functionally useless. These where stored in a ventilated plastic bin, washed after each use and not stored in sunlight. I have a fins that have lasted decades that cost the same. These are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Adams

customer_reviews.title: Cressi makes awesome equipment
customer_reviews.text: So far the best fins I've ever owned. I've always used to use a monofin back home but couldn't bring that with me to Greece. So I got these for my snorkeling adventures out here with my husband, and I'm in love. I wish I could take these back home with me but I would have no room in my carry on. I was afraid they were going to be too stiff but their flexibility is perfect! They're comfortable and effortless. I glide through the water with little effort but go pretty fast, I often have to stop to let my husband catch up. May buy another pair when I get back home.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: I wear them with 2 mil booties and they fit great. I have been using them for lobster diving ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 12 shoes and bought the size 10/11. I wear them with 2 mil booties and they fit great. I have been using them for lobster diving in the eel grass and shallower water. They are a little flimsy for that. You really have to kick which brings the heart rate up and lowers bottom time. As for swimming laps in a pool I'm sure they would be great. I'm a little over 200 pounds so something a little stiffer would propel me better. Other than that, the quality is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great company great fins
customer_reviews.text: I want to thank the company for being patient to wait until I healed enough to try them out. They gave me extra time as I crashed on rollerblading right after I made the purchase. I’m happy with the fins. They’re a bit stiffer than expected &! I have very small feet but bought a small size even then they’re a bit loose in the heel. I highly recommend this product and the company itself
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Bianco

customer_reviews.title: Loved having my own gear that had NOT been soaking ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved having my own gear that had NOT been soaking in bleach water or worn by who knows. I matched from my snorkel to my fins. I looked great and was first in the water on y trips. I didn't have to wait in line for gear and try on sizes. I just unzipped my gear bag and splash! I was snorkeling while others waited 30 more minutes. Get them! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: P. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Update: Wore these about 10 times in my life. One broke in half during my PADI Openwater dive 2 & forced me to purchase new ones from a dive shop. Surprised they broke, but very upset with purchase.... Old Review: Marvelous find. Purchased for snorkeling and diving, and they fit perfectly. I wore them for over 12 hours in a week and had no problems with rubbing nor blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected! Very nice and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pcs~and it fit my foots as expected~i bought 33-34 SIZE 1-2~normally I wear woman EU38 US7
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine C.

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is big.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's 7.5 US (mens 6 ish) but in this model I needed to purchase the mens 2.5-3.5. Maybe they are sized assuming you will be wearing a sock or boot? Regardless, they were comfortable and worked well. Stayed on my feet well.
customer_reviews.author: thrifty shopper

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, cute, not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Decent fins, not very powerful for scuba diving. Knew they were lightweight and wanted them for Caribbean travel, got some foot cramps and had to struggle to move as quickly underwater as my fellow divers with sturdier fins
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Take your own fins instead of renting
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of fins for snorkeling. I wear them with small neoprene booties to improve the fit. They are a bit stiff but work well to move through currents. After trying both, my daughter preferred the U.S. Divers Adult Trek Travel Fin. You get more power from the Pluma but they require a bit more effort than the smaller Trek Travel fins. Would certainly recommend either over the cheap pool fins that snorkel tours provide!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - purchase as one time use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for girlfriend. Really cheap. Cracked after the 4th use. I own a bunch of cressi ans scubapro gear and have been happy with it, this is pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: SSA

customer_reviews.title: Great fins.
customer_reviews.text: Would purchase a second pair. My foot is a 6.5 or 7. Great fit. I paired with 2mm neoprene boogie for extra comfort and long wear. My daughter is Size 8 and wore the fins with no bootie and said they were comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pattee

customer_reviews.title: Love the pink, but these are really long!
customer_reviews.text: These are very long, serious fins. Probably better for ocean dives than pool recreational use. Cressi has excellent quality but I prefer their Rondine model for a shorter, softer product.
customer_reviews.author: Rr

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience with the seller, product was way too small despite website description.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is beautiful, but the size was way too small. I returned it and even though it was unused they charged me a 50% restocking fee. Don't recommend this seller at all.
customer_reviews.author: StephReis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality...order a size down though. They fit bigger than what you expect. My girls and I wear a size 7.5 to 8 shoe. The 35/36 fin is a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Bluebonnet

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what size to get because I wanted them to be snug. I wear a women's size 7-8 typically and was able to wear these with ease, even though the equivalent in European is smaller than my normal size. A larger size might not have stayed on as well in the water, so I'm glad that these fit. I love, love, love the color and design!
customer_reviews.author: Sunchild327

customer_reviews.title: Durable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Used these in my trip to Hawaii. I am a size 6 1/2 to 7. I was able to swim with the turtles and dive down to the reef. Super cute color and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: RoxyHoney

customer_reviews.title: nice fins
customer_reviews.text: the fins are size small 2.5-4. I wear shoe size 3.5 and the fins are a little large, but they are light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: l w rob

customer_reviews.title: Great fins!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! they went on great in the water, never slipped around and didnt cause any blisters! love!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Moore

customer_reviews.title: These fins were a really good fit for me
customer_reviews.text: These fins were a really good fit for me. I am a 7 1/2 or 8 foot and the 35/36 fit me great. They maybe have a touch of space at the toe, but it was perfect because I was swimming with neoprene socks. Great purchase and really good brand.
customer_reviews.author: amanda niebuhr

customer_reviews.title: The sizing information was good. I wear a ladies size 6 and ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews on the Cressi Pluma Fins and based on those reviews and sizing recommendations, I the ordered them for an upcoming dive trip. The sizing information was good. I wear a ladies size 6 and ordered the 2.5/3.5. The foot pocket is wider than my current fins, but I use a thin aqua sock and these are perfect! I find the Acona sock offers protection from any rubbing and comes in handy when entering the boat. The fins offered good propulsion for me during the dive (I am of smaller stature). They also worked fine for snorkeling. Would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... bigger on web but reality no but it look good quality i will edit when i use it
customer_reviews.text: it look bigger on web but reality no but it look good quality i will edit when i use it
customer_reviews.author: Einstein

customer_reviews.title: 35/36 Run Big. My heel slips out. I ...
customer_reviews.text: 35/36 Run Big. My heel slips out. I will go back to using the 35/36 Cressi Clio which fit perfectly on my size 7 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Drew W Hall

product_meta.title: Cressi Adult Snorkeling Full Foot Pocket Fins made with Advanced Technology - Pluma: made in Italy
product_meta.description: This high-tech fin designed specifically for snorkeling benefits from the best technologies used in free diving and scuba diving. Cressi’s unique molding process also allows for the use of three separate materials to create a highly-responsive blade. Now, snorkelers can power through current and enjoy hours on the water without undue muscle strain. The Pluma’s computer-designed foot pocket provides excellent power transmission and unparalleled comfort.
feature_bullets: Cressi is a REAL diving, snorkeling and swimming Italian brand, since 1946.
A lightweight and full foot fin, ideal for snorkeling and scuba diving. Made in Italy by Cressi's manufactory.
Made by molding three different materials (a Cressi patented construction system) to give high performance, extreme lightness, easy fining, and comfort.
The blade is made from light and reactive polypropylene, it is very-energetic and has snappy rebound. The result is powerful, fluid and untiring kick.
The foot pocket extends along the bottom of the blade to give protection during fining even in shallow water and near rocks.
